org.usefultoys.slf4j.meter

Class MeterConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usefultoys.slf4j.meter.MeterConfig

  • public class MeterConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of properties that drive Meter and MeterData behavior. Initial values are read from system properties, if available. Some properties allow reassigning their values at runtime.

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • progressPeriodMilliseconds

        public static long progressPeriodMilliseconds
        Time to wait before reporting next progress status, in milliseconds. Meter allows reporting progress status of incremental operations by calling the Meter.inc(), Meter.incBy(long) and Meter.incTo(long) method on each step. To prevent crowding the log file and to prevent performance degradation, Meter waits a minimal amount of time before printing the next status message. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.meter.progress.period at application startup and defaults to 2 seconds. The number represents a long integer that represents milliseconds. The system property allows the number suffixed with 'ms', 's', 'm' and 'h' to represent milliseconds, seconds, minutes and hours. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • printCategory

        public static boolean printCategory
        If Meter and MeterData print the category on the 1-line summary message. The category groups operations that are closely related. Usually, the category is the same as logger name declared within the class that creates the `Meter`. The usual logger configuration already includes the logger name. But if your logger configuration omits the logger name, then you may set this property to true. Value is read from system property slf4jtoys.meter.print.category at application startup, defaults to false. You may assign a new value at runtime.

      • MeterConfig
